tasks.task: Applying weed management techniques in Florida strawberries
subtasks: Fumigation with picloram and Tellone C35
Using the Florida three-way fumigation combination (picloram, KPM, and Tellone C35) for better weed control and economic return
Applying pre-emergence herbicides over plastic mulch using a bed press with nozzles
Utilizing Chateau (flumioxazin) as the pre-emergence herbicide of choice in Florida strawberries
Targeting selective weed control with Chateau, considering its persistence and safety
Managing ragweed parthenium in strawberry fields using alternative control methods
Employing cover crops during the fallow period to suppress weeds and reduce seed production
Utilizing K-PAM (VAPAM) for crop termination and weed control at higher rates (40 gallons per acre) for optimal results
Integrating relay cropping for two harvests in the same growing season
Using a shield device for herbicide application to remove strawberries without damaging the second crop.
